docs.abstract: The concept of “frugal innovation” presents the challenge of designing products specifically to meet the needs of the world’s poorest people.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Senate hopeful Cory Gardner's opposition to abortion rights "is way too extreme for Colorado," women voters say in ads Senate Democrats' campaign arm began running Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York's new health commissioner isn't interested in being a nanny. Think of her more as a tutor.

docs.lead_paragraph: A suburban Cincinnati clinic will stop performing surgical abortions as a result of a 2013 state law that bars agreements to move women needing emergency care to public hospitals, an attorney for the clinic said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Ohio Clinic to Halt Surgical Abortions Due to 2013 State Law
headline.print_headline: Ohio Clinic to Halt Surgical Abortions Due to 2013 State Law

docs.snippet: A suburban Cincinnati clinic will stop performing surgical abortions as a result of a 2013 state law that bars agreements to move women needing emergency care to public hospitals, an attorney for the clinic said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans counting on an unpopular president and a favorable electoral landscape to help them win control of the U.S. Senate  could have another asset this year - stronger candidates who are less likely to say embarrassing things.

headline.main: Republicans See Senate Chances Bolstered by Primary Results
headline.print_headline: Republicans See Senate Chances Bolstered by Primary Results

docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of people rallied in Dublin to call for a change to Ireland's abortion laws on Wednesday after a rape victim said she was refused a termination and instead gave birth by Cesarean section.

headline.main: Hundreds Rally in Ireland After Rape Victim Says Denied Abortion
headline.print_headline: Hundreds Rally in Ireland After Rape Victim Says Denied Abortion

docs.snippet: Hundreds of people rallied in Dublin to call for a change to Ireland's abortion laws on Wednesday after a rape victim said she was refused a termination and instead gave birth by Cesarean section.

docs.abstract: While many Americans try to protect their privacy, one man wants to get rid of it entirely. But what would a world without privacy look like?
docs.snippet: While many Americans try to protect their privacy, one man wants to get rid of it entirely. But what would a world without privacy look like?

docs.lead_paragraph: A migrant who said she was raped in her homeland before traveling to Ireland gave birth by Caesarean section when she was 24 weeks pregnant after Irish doctors rejected her request for an abortion on the grounds of suicidal thoughts, The Irish Times reported on Tuesday.

headline.main: Migrant Rape Victim Denied Abortion in Ireland: Paper
headline.print_headline: Migrant Rape Victim Denied Abortion in Ireland: Paper

docs.lead_paragraph: A Chicago woman whose beaten body was found stuffed in a suitcase on the Indonesian resort island of Bali was repeatedly and violently abused by the daughter who has been arrested in her killing, according to police reports.

headline.main: American Slain in Bali, Daughter Had Troubled Past
headline.print_headline: American Slain in Bali, Daughter Had Troubled Past

docs.snippet: A Chicago woman whose beaten body was found stuffed in a suitcase on the Indonesian resort island of Bali was repeatedly and violently abused by the daughter who has been arrested in her killing, according to police reports.
